definition: Chushu or End of Heat, 14th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 23rd August-7th September
to reside/to live/to dwell/to be in/to be situated at/to stay/to get along with/to be in a position of/to deal with/to discipline/to punish
place/location/spot/point/office/department/bureau/respect/classifier for locations or items of damage: spot, point
heat/hot weather/summer heat

sentences.english: Chushu solar terms in each year around August 23.
sentences.chinese: 处暑节气在每年八月二十三日左右。

sentences.english: Abhorrent still wandering, autumn season will alert the scorching.
sentences.chinese: 可恶秋老虎仍彷徨，处暑时节要鉴戒。

sentences.english: The scorching, sooner or later, see him out at noon autumn.
sentences.chinese: 处暑牵来秋老虎，早晚不见午间出。

definition: Liqiu or Start of Autumn, 13th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 7th-22nd August
Xiaoshu or Lesser Heat, 11th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 7th-22nd July
Dashu or Great Heat, 12th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 23rd July-6th August
Qiufen or Autumn Equinox, 16th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 23rd September-7th October
Shuangjiang or Frost Descends, 18th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 23rd October-6th November
Hanlu or Cold Dew, 17th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 8th-22nd October
Xiazhi or Summer Solstice, 10th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 21st June-6th July
Mangzhong or Grain in Beard, 9th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 6th-20th June
Chunfen or Spring Equinox, 4th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 21st March-4th April
Lidong or Start of Winter, 19th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 7th-21st November
solar term
middle ten days of August, the last of 三伏 sān fú, three hottest periods of the year
Lixia or Start of Summer, 7th of the 24 solar terms 二十四節氣|二十四节气 5th-20th May
middle ten days of July, the first of 三伏 sān fú, three hottest periods of the year
the hottest period of the year/see 三伏天[san1 fu2 tian1]
end of 三伏[san1 fu2] (the hottest period of the year)
